text: hey design folks just wanted to let you know that i reached out to mackenzie after ewald had a chance to evaluate candidates as well, and unfortunately she's in talks with another studio so is no longer a candidate for us. wamp wamp
bummer. she was talented.
to that end, I think we should do initial screens with anybody that anybody feels is strong for one reason or another
having gone thru trello yesterday, clearly late, there's debate of this sort or that sort
if matt or melissa think there's promise, let's do initial screen
i didn't see any reason why we shouldn't have talked to her
if only to keep the ball rolling
right
well i'll make sure to do that
i appreciate my own input, but can't make it a bottleneck
i trust your gut instincts, and at most we lose 30 minutes talking to somebody interesting
or we gain an incredible intern
sure thing
sorry it was my delay that put us in this position.
no no
certainly wasn't the intention
oh no, it 1000% is
i disagree, i think our bar was set either too high, or in a weird spot initially
let's loosen that bar and talk to people we think are interesting
agreed
and doing so
i know it's more time consuming (kinda), but let's not have that email come again
or at least be in their running before it does
very sorry for my own bar setting/weird/schedule.
to be fair, abby and I both really liked her. There was disagreement in trello. What was she supposed to do?
oh - i'm not setting blame
i think y'all were waiting on me
as arbitration or something.
it doesn't matter, we'll fix it moving forward
but yes, i initially did want to talk with her
if anything, i'm squarely pointing at myself.
I vote to officially strike "no interactive" as an auto no
it has been, if not officially
I think that's fine, and for the record, it was never a thing
'officially'
if i'm the official?
anyway - let's fix for future. Apologies that I set this off in a strange direction.

I'll also ask that for any further on the fencer candidates that come in, grab a room vs. trello. Hash out whatever needs hashing. Certainly use trello for comments as we have been, but if there are any more debates for whatever reason, just grab each other to discuss in timely manner. That's where I think my own schedule especially fucked this up
debate is good - it helps point us to better people. Trello isn't a good format for it
ok
Sorry guys. I do feel strongly that any intern we have at least some interactive experience. Looks like I'm outnumbered, but that's why I was trying to hold that ground.

i think it's totally fair to look for interactive experience, but it's also important to take into account the program they're in and what they hope to learn. if they have a strong interest in getting into it and have solid design skills generally, i think that's just as good
yes, if there's no interactive there should absolutely be expressed interest. That's kind of what was missing for me with Mackenzie... either of those things.

yea i hear ya, well i'm feeling like we really don't have many design applicants overall or that reach our initial requirement of strong design skills which leads me to widening the prerequisites a bit
do you really think people are applying to Uncorked without an expressed interest in interactive?
I think the job post is pretty clear.

I think that people send out applications to design studios without understanding the specifics of what they do. I'm not saying she's not interested, I'm just saying she didn't express her interest in any way. Not trying to start an argument here.
Ok ok. Dead issue guys.
She's gone, let's fucking do better and talk more. The end
in other news - Dev folks! i chatted with karen and do not believe she's our gal unfortunately. happy to chat through any of the thoughts behind that decision
so i'm looking forward to seeing Connor's homework on monday and chatting with you all about the state of the dev intern union
also, producer folks! i have a phone screen with alexsis on Monday, we're interviewing Grant on Monday, and Mary will be speaking with Sally on Monday as well. I'm excited to see how those pan out
and for anyone that's interested I think i've pretty much passed on Spice. even though that would be a great name to have around the office.
she might get tired of me saying "Spice up your life!"
woah, i wonder if she gets that a lot
actually, i'm more curious if she ever uses it herself
probably at least as often as I get meow'd at
ha
